```{r ,message=FALSE}
install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
```
## learning to reference figures {#figure}

```{r Figref, fig.cap="This is random noise"}
x = seq(1:100)
y = rnorm(100)
dat = data.frame(x, y)
ggplot(dat, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
geom_line() 
```
In Figure\@ref(fig:Figref), we plot x versus y as line plot. 

## learning to reference table {#table}

```{r tabref}
knitr::kable(head(dat,5), caption = " this is the first 5 rows")
```

In table \@ref(tab:tabref), we show first 5 rows of the data.

## Conclusion

In section \@ref(figure), we learn how to reference figures.

while in section \@ref(table),we learn how to reference table.
